title: new version 131.0.2
content:
I just installed the new Firefox version (131.0.2) and the installation gave me a new desktop lnk (the old one is still on the desktop). The new link (to an .exe file in "C:...\AppData\Local\Mozilla Firefox\browser") starts the new version of Firefox in its newborn virgin state, i.e., EVERYTHING from my previous version is missing.

The old link (which points to an identical .exe file in a completely different directory "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\browser" with same date stamp as the .exe file mentioned above) when executed results in an error message: Platform version '131.0' is not compatible with 

                                                                                              minVersion >= 131.0.2                                                                                               maxVersion <= 131.0.2

NOTE: The files in each of these two directories appears to be identical. I really want my old profile back.

HELP!
creator: randomprop

title: Text suggestions don't work properly in Discord with Firefox on Windows 11
content: I'm on Windows 11 and when I type in Discord with Firefox the text suggestions stop working after two words. It works perfectly everywhere else including the Discord app as well as Discord in any other browser.

title: Atalhos errados!!! Dor de cabeça
content:
Olá!

Eu nem sei o que falar, com tanta e imensa RAIVAAA que estou, eu deixei todos os atalhos certos do firefox no sistema linux, fui instalar o firefox no windows e esses atalhos não estava correto, estava imcompletos, então eu criei outros atalhos de acordo aquele sistema que eu iria acessar. E hoje 09/10/2024 acessando o firefox no sistema linux eu vi que os atalhos que configurei certinho sumiu dando preferencia para os atalhos do linux, que merd&!! eu configurei tudo certinho atalhos importantes e foi desconfigurado, VOCÊS NÃO SABE COMO ESTOU PUTO COM ISSO!

Espero que resolva essa merda! coloca a porr$ dos atalhos de volta

title: Closing pages before I'm done
content: First of all, there's this new thing called AI. Maybe you've heard about it when you meet a competitor at a party, etc. If you ever choose to use it (a pretty big "if"), you might install it in your forums. Nah, that ain't likely. But here's the question: How can I get FF to quit closing pages (photos, music, Word docs) when I want to save them? One of the problems is your FAQs are programmed to read CRASH, when they "see" CLOSING PAGES. I know, FAQs are there to make Mozilla more $$$$. They have nothing to do with customer service.
creator: DBergendorf
